message_1: Suppose that you want to encrypt the message "HELLO" using Caesar cipher with a key of 7. What would be the encrypted message?
message_2:
To encrypt the message "HELLO" using a Caesar cipher with a key of 7, you would shift each letter in the message 7 positions forward in the alphabet. If a letter goes past "Z", it wraps around to the beginning of the alphabet.

Here's the encryption process for each letter in "HELLO":

H -> O (shift 7 positions forward)
E -> L (shift 7 positions forward)
L -> S (shift 7 positions forward)
L -> S (shift 7 positions forward)
O -> V (shift 7 positions forward)

So, the encrypted message would be "OLSSV".
